poem:
**Lyrids Over London**

In the east,  
trails of dust  
thread the night's  
dark cloth—  
ancient sparks  
scatter luminous seeds,  
a fleeting garden  
sown by fire.  
Eyes lift  
to embrace  
this silent bloom,  
woven from  
forgotten paths—  
whispers of space,  
etching a moment  
in the air,  
a celestial breath,  
constellation--  
born, passing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starwatch: Lyrid meteor showers to grace skies with annual stellar show The peak of the world’s oldest known meteor showers will grace the skies this week. The Lyrid meteor shower is active from 16-25 April but is at its height on Monday night. The chart shows the view looking east from London at midnight as 21 April becomes 22 April. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
